result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter C Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to any other sentences deft is currently serving.

No contact with contacts. 

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

SAFE program.  

DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter C Johnson

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:30 PM
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF131, 22CF395, 22CF396, and 22CT12

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Dan Cveykus.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF131
COUNT 2: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), Repeater >> DRI.
22CF396
COUNT 1: Strangulation and Suffocation, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.
22CT12
COUNT 1: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Ignition Interlock Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF131:
COUNT 1: OWI (4th), Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
22CF395:
COUNT 1: Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
22CF396
COUNT 2: Battery, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
On 21CF131: 2 years WPS (1 yr IC; 1 yr ES), CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; $2,452.00 fine inclusive; AODA and f/u; Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 26 months; 26 months DL revocation with any administrative credit; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; and No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.  

On 22CF395: 3.5 years WPS (18 MNTHS IC; 2 yrs ES), CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; $4,000.00 restitution and 10% surcharge; No contact with victims; SAFE Program; DNA sample and surcharge; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; and CC. 

On 22CF396: 2 years WPS (1 yr IC; 1yr ES), CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; No contact with victims; SAFE Program; DNA sample and surcharge; DV Surcharge; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; and CC. 

All counts to run concurrent to each other and to any other sentences the defendant is currently serving. Not eligible for programming at this time. 162 days jail credit on all counts.

INCLUDES 22CF131, 22CF395, 22CF396, 22CT12.  No contact with victim(s):  A.L.M., J.D.M.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  c  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
